it.essepuntato.earmark.core
Class MarkupItem

java.lang.Object
  it.essepuntato.earmark.core.MarkupItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
EARMARKChildNode, EARMARKHierarchicalNode, EARMARKItem, EARMARKNode, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Attribute, Comment, Element
public abstract class MarkupItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements EARMARKItem, EARMARKHierarchicalNode, EARMARKChildNode

This class represents an abstract markup item in the EARMARK model.

Author:
Silvio Peroni

setId

protected void setId(java.net.URI newId)

This method changes the id of the markup item with a new one. If the new id specified is equal to EARMARKDocument.reservedDocumentId, no change is performed.

Each modification to the id is not propagated to all the structures involved and, consequently, may result in wrong behaviours and/or collateral effects.

It is usually reserved for internal use only.

Parameters:
newId - the new local id for the markup item.

setEARMARKDocument

protected void setEARMARKDocument(EARMARKDocument d)

This method sets the EARMARK document associated to this markup item.

Each modification to the id is not propagated to all the structures involved and, consequently, may result in wrong behaviours and/or collateral effects.

It is usually reserved for internal use only.

Parameters:
d - the EARMARK document related to the markup item.

setType

protected void setType(Collection.Type t)

This method sets the EARMARK node as the type specified.

Each modification to the id is not propagated to all the structures involved and, consequently, may result in wrong behaviours and/or collateral effects.

It is usually reserved for internal use only.

Parameters:
t - the type to be set.

cloneNode

public EARMARKNode cloneNode(boolean deep)
This method clones the markup item.

Specified by:
cloneNode in interface EARMARKNode
Parameters:
deep - if false, it corresponds to call the method clone(); if true, the markup item will be cloned using the method clone() and then all the other child nodes of it will be cloned (cloneNode) as well and appended as child of the new cloned markup item.
Returns:
the cloned markup item.

getFirstChild

public EARMARKChildNode getFirstChild()
Description copied from interface: EARMARKHierarchicalNode
The first child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns null. If the current node is a bag or a set, a random node is returned.

Specified by:
getFirstChild in interface EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Returns:
the first node child.

Specified by:
getLastChild in interface EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Returns:
the last node child.

getNextSibling

public EARMARKChildNode getNextSibling()
Description copied from interface: EARMARKChildNode
This method returns the next siblings of the node. If more than one siblings exist, the method chooses one randomly from the next sibling list. Though in a common XML document there exists one possible next sibling only, in EARMARK it is possible to have more than one sibling, because of different hierarchies and multiple references.

Specified by:
getNextSibling in interface EARMARKChildNode
Returns:
a next-sibling of the node or null if it does not exist.

getNextSiblings

public java.util.Set<EARMARKChildNode> getNextSiblings()
Description copied from interface: EARMARKChildNode
This method returns all the next siblings of the node. Though in a common XML document there exists one possible next sibling only, in EARMARK it is possible to have more than one sibling, because of different hierarchies and multiple references.

Specified by:
getNextSiblings in interface EARMARKChildNode
Returns:
a set containing all the next-siblings of the node.

getParentNode

public EARMARKHierarchicalNode getParentNode()
Description copied from interface: EARMARKChildNode
The parent of this node. All nodes, except EARMARKNode.Type.Document may have a parent. If a node has more than one parent, it returns one randomly. However, if a node has just been created and not yet added to the graph, or if it has been removed from the graph, this method returns null.

Specified by:
getParentNode in interface EARMARKChildNode
Returns:
a parent of this node.

getParentNodes

public java.util.Set<EARMARKHierarchicalNode> getParentNodes()
Description copied from interface: EARMARKChildNode
This method returns the parents of this node. All nodes, except EARMARKNode.Type.Document may have a parent. However, if a node has just been created and not yet added to set graph, or if it has been removed from the graph, this method returns an empty list.

Specified by:
getParentNodes in interface EARMARKChildNode
Returns:
all the parents of this node.

insertBefore

public EARMARKChildNode insertBefore(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                                     EARMARKChildNode refChild)
                              throws EARMARKGraphException
Description copied from interface: EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Inserts the node newChild before the first existing child node refChild of the node. If refChild is null, insert newChild at the end of the list of children. This operation makes sense if and only if the EARMARK node is a markup item and its type is Collection.Type.Sequence.

Specified by:
insertBefore in interface EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Parameters:
newChild - the node to insert.
refChild - the reference node, i.e., the node before which the new node must be inserted.
Returns:
the node being inserted.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] newChild or refChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

insertBefore

public EARMARKChildNode insertBefore(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                                     EARMARKChildNode refChild,
                                     int occurrence)
                              throws EARMARKGraphException
Description copied from interface: EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Inserts the node newChild before the existing child node by occurrence refChild of the node. If refChild is null, insert newChild at the end of the list of children. This operation makes sense if and only if the EARMARK node is a markup item and its type is Collection.Type.Sequence.

Specified by:
insertBefore in interface EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Parameters:
newChild - the node to insert.
refChild - the reference node, i.e., the node before which the new node must be inserted.
occurrence - the occurrence of the refChild to consider.
Returns:
the node being inserted.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] newChild or refChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

isEqualNode

public boolean isEqualNode(EARMARKNode node)

This method checks if the markup item is equal to another node.

A markup item is equal to another node either if they are the same node (isSameNode) or if they are both markup items of the same type having same general identifier and namespace, and their structures are equal (i.e., they contains equal nodes in the same hierarchical order).

Specified by:
isEqualNode in interface EARMARKNode
Parameters:
node - the node to compare equality with.
Returns:
true if the nodes are equal, false otherwise.

isStructurallyEqualNode

public boolean isStructurallyEqualNode(EARMARKNode node)

This method checks if the markup item is structurally equivalent to another node.

A markup item is structurally equivalent to another node either if they are both markup items of the same type having same general identifier and namespace, and their structures are structurally equivalent (i.e., they contains structurally equivalent nodes in the same hierarchical order).

Specified by:
isStructurallyEqualNode in interface EARMARKNode
Parameters:
node - the node to compare equality with.
Returns:
true if the nodes are equal, false otherwise.

isSameNode

public boolean isSameNode(EARMARKNode node)
Description copied from interface: EARMARKNode
This methods check if two nodes are the same, i.e., they have the same identifier.

Specified by:
isSameNode in interface EARMARKNode
Parameters:
node - the node to test against.
Returns:
true if the nodes are the same, false otherwise.

                                        EARMARKChildNode oldChild)
                                 throws EARMARKGraphException
Description copied from interface: EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Replace the all child node oldChild with newChild in the collection of children of the node, and returns the oldChild node. If the oldChild does not exist, it returns null.
